result.execSummary:
The defendant Tommy Lee Pryor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,105.00 payable to Michael P.  To be paid prior to court costs and all aplicable surcharges/assesmsents.

No alcohol or controlled substances.

Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge if not already provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Decision And Order Partially Granting Motion For Additional Sentence Credit; Denying Motion For Sentence Clarification; And Denying Motion To Vacate DNA Surcharges - it is further ordered that the clerk's office shall correct the assessment for the DNA surcharge on count four in 15CF001303.  The DNA surcharge for this conviction is $200 pursuant to section 973.046(1r)(b), Stats. - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to all counts.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on all counts as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 7 1/2 years of sentencing.
-Restitution set at $1,105.00 payable to Michael P.  Restitution to be paid prior to court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already provided;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-No contact with Michael P., his family and residence
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to  COUNT 1 and any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 7 1/2 years of sentencing.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already provided;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 18 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 7 1/2 years of sentencing.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already provided;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 18 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 7 1/2 years of sentencing.
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge if not already provided;  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Tommy Lee Pryor not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Court Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court sets this matter for trial, final pretrial and one last plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:00 am. All motion papers are to be filed on or before the final pretrial date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Tommy Lee Pryor not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to Court's congested calendar, matter rescheduled for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Tommy Lee Pryor not in court, in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference. Defense requested a projected guilty plea date. Parties request that case #14CM1515 be handled by this Court for global resolution. Court does not object. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Tommy Lee Pryor not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waiting on discovery and there may be a possibility additional charges will be issued.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku in court, defendant Tommy Lee Pryor not in court, in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Defense awaiting additional discovery materials.  Parties still engaged in negotiations for global resolution of both felony matters pending before Branch 21.  Joint request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in custody.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.P., K.P., A.R., T.B., L.O.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Tommy Lee Pryor in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
